intro: Alsine barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrière's alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many other flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, often in pink or white hues, contributing to its ornamental value.
